valence.analyze.gcquant.gcquant module¶

class valence.analyze.gcquant.gcquant.GCQuant(lib, area, standards)[source]¶

Bases: object

quantifies the concentrations based on calibration curves using dataframes generated from Agilent

Constructors:
align: aligns lib and tic/fid on r.t.

valence.analyze.gcquant.gcquant_methods module¶

class valence.analyze.gcquant.gcquant_methods.GCMethods[source]¶

Bases: object

cal_curves(matched_cal_conc)[source]¶

take a matched calibration concentration dataframe (matched_cal_conc) and does a linear regression and returns a dataframe of the library_ids with linregress stats and the min/max areas which is the range for which the calibration curve can (should only) be used. this is only for cases where each molecule has a calibration curve i.e. tic and/or fid
